question.title: Shape
question.text: Is the galaxy simply smooth and rounded, with no sign of a disk?
question.help: The aim here is to divide featureless galaxies from all the rest. If you can see any interesting features at all, click "features or disk." Just occasionally you might see something that isn't a galaxy at all - the long streak of a satellite, for example, or a image swamped by light from a bright star. If this happens, just click "star or artifact". Click to see larger images.

question.title: Disk
question.text: Could this be a disk viewed edge-on?
question.help: Disc galaxies are very thin, so look different when viewed from the side. We're trying to find exactly edge-on galaxies with this question. If the galaxy looks needle-like, perhaps with a bulge at the centre, then click "yes," otherwise choose "no" (even for galaxies almost edge-on). Click to see larger images.

question.title: Spiral
question.text: How many spiral arms are there?

question.title: Discuss
question.text: Would you like to discuss this object?
question.help: If you have any questions about this object, or think it may be interesting to others, or just have something to say, you can start a discussion on Talk by clicking "Yes". Talk will open in a new window - just close it to come back to the classification page.

question.title: Bar
question.text: Is there any sign of a bar feature through the center of the galaxy?
question.help: Sometimes galaxies have a prominent straight "bar" running through their centre, and that's what we're looking for here. Click to see larger images.

question.title: Spiral
question.text: Is there any sign of a spiral arm pattern?
question.help: Look carefully for spiral arms - remember they may be embedded in the disk and not that easy to see. Click to see larger images.

question.title: Bulge
question.text: How prominent is the central bulge, compared with the rest of the galaxy?
question.help: It's not always easy to tell, but look at the centre of the galaxy for a round bulge of stars which may obscure any bar and the spiral arms in this central region. Click to see larger images.

question.title: Odd
question.help: We're looking for signs that the galaxy is merging, is disturbed, or has other unusual features. Click to see larger images.

question.title: Bulge
question.text: Does the galaxy have a bulge at its center? If so, what shape?
question.help: Concentrate on the centre of the galaxy - if it has a smooth, uninterrupted, needle or lens-shape then click "no bulge." Otherwise your options are "rounded" bulge or "boxy" (but boxy bulges are rare). Click to see larger images.
